etymology.interpretation: Combines 婁/娄 for the sound with 攴 ‘to tap/strike,’ evoking actions like tallying or making counting marks. The simplified form keeps the same cues, only reducing the strokes of the phonetic component.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the phonetic 婁 with its simplified form 娄 to reduce strokes, yielding 数; this variant is attested since the Ming. The semantic component 攴 is retained as its variant 攵.

examples.chinese: 这个数很大(這個數很大)。
他会数到一百(他會數到一百)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huì shǔ dào yì bǎi.
examples.english: He can count to one hundred.

examples.chinese: 请把这个数再核对一下(請把這個數再核對一下)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ zhège shù zài héduì yíxià.
